### Session 2: *The Art and Beauty of Data Visualization* with Moritz Stefaner

A special event! A talk by a leading data visualization expert.

**11:15 - 12:30 Room RLH 274 (as part of Current Topics Seminars)**

*Speaker:* [Moritz Stefaner](https://truth-and-beauty.net/)

*Title:* **The Art and Beauty of Data Visualization**

*Abstract:* As an independent Truth & Beauty Operator, Moritz Stefaner is constantly chasing the perfect shape for information ‚Äî how can we create expressive, intriguing, and elegant data experiences? Drawing on high-profile projects for the German government, WHO, and OECD, as well as innovative creative explorations, he demonstrates how effective data visualization can achieve much more than simply making charts look nicer.


::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="63%"}
*Short Bio:* With a background in Cognitive Science and Interface Design, his work beautifully balances analytical and aesthetic aspects in mapping complex phenomena to support data‚Äìdriven decision making. Moritz has helped clients like the OECD, Google News Initiative, Salesforce, the World Economic Forum, Deutsche Bahn and the Max Planck Research Society to find insights and beauty in large and complex data sets. He is the record winner of the Kantar Information is Beautiful awards and his work has been exhibited at Venice Biennale of Architecture, SIGGRAPH, Max Planck Science Gallery, Fondation EDF, and Ars Electronica. As a writer, co-host of the [Data Stories podcast](https://datastori.es/), and sought-after keynote speaker and workshop facilitator, Moritz Stefaner continues to excite more and more people about the magic that can emerge when art and science connect deeply.
